faculty.title: Director & Professor of Cultural Studies
faculty.bio: Dr. Patricia Glinton-Meicholas is a renowned Bahamian author, educator, and cultural preservationist. She has dedicated her career to documenting and celebrating Caribbean cultural traditions through literature and education. Her extensive work in folklore and storytelling has helped preserve countless traditional tales and customs for future generations. As Director of CAPAS, she brings visionary leadership and deep cultural knowledge to guide the institution's mission.
education: Ph.D. in Caribbean Literature, University of the West Indies
M.A. in English Literature, University of London
B.A. in English, College of The Bahamas
achievements: Author of 12 published books on Caribbean culture
Recipient of the Bahamas Independence Award
UNESCO Cultural Ambassador
Founder of the Caribbean Folklore Institute

studentTestimonials.name: Marcus Johnson
studentTestimonials.quote: Dr. Glinton-Meicholas opened my eyes to the rich cultural heritage of our islands. Her passion is contagious.

studentTestimonials.name: Sophia Williams
studentTestimonials.quote: She doesn't just teach culture, she lives it. Every class is a journey through our heritage.

faculty.title: Professor of Visual Arts & Cultural Expression
faculty.bio: Professor Antonius Roberts is a celebrated visual artist whose work bridges traditional Caribbean aesthetics with contemporary artistic expression. His paintings and installations have been exhibited internationally, bringing Bahamian art to global attention. At CAPAS, he mentors emerging artists while continuing his own creative practice, emphasizing the importance of cultural authenticity in contemporary art.
education: M.F.A. in Visual Arts, Yale School of Art
B.F.A. in Painting, Rhode Island School of Design
Certificate in Caribbean Art History, University of the West Indies
achievements: International exhibitions in 15 countries
Bahamas National Gallery permanent collection
UNESCO Artist for Peace designation
Founder of the Contemporary Caribbean Art Movement

studentTestimonials.name: Isabella Martinez
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Roberts taught me to see my Caribbean heritage as a strength in my artistic voice.

studentTestimonials.name: David Thompson
studentTestimonials.quote: His critiques are honest but always constructive. He pushes you to find your authentic style.

faculty.title: Head of Vocal Performance
faculty.bio: Professor Sarah Dash brings world-class vocal training to CAPAS with over 20 years of professional performance experience. Having performed on stages from Carnegie Hall to the Royal Opera House, she now dedicates her expertise to developing the next generation of Caribbean vocalists. Her teaching method uniquely combines classical technique with the rich vocal traditions of the Caribbean.
education: M.M. in Vocal Performance, Juilliard School
B.M. in Voice, Oberlin Conservatory
Certificate in Caribbean Music Studies, Berklee College of Music
achievements: Soloist with major international orchestras
Grammy nomination for Caribbean Voices album
Metropolitan Opera House debut
Founder of the Caribbean Vocal Academy

studentTestimonials.name: Michael Brown
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Dash transformed my voice and my confidence. Her technique is unmatched.

studentTestimonials.name: Alicia Roberts
studentTestimonials.quote: She teaches with such passion and precision. Every lesson brings new discoveries.

faculty.title: Professor of Steel Drum & Caribbean Percussion
faculty.bio: Master Ricardo Clarke is widely recognized as one of the Caribbean's finest steel drum artists and educators. With over 30 years of performance and teaching experience, he has helped establish steel drum programs throughout the region. His innovative arrangements and teaching methods have influenced a generation of Caribbean musicians and brought steel drum music to international prominence.
education: Master's Certificate in Music Education, University of the West Indies
Bachelor of Music in Percussion, Berklee College of Music
Traditional Steel Drum Mastery, Trinidad Pan Masters
achievements: International Steel Drum Champion (5 times)
Arranger for major Carnival productions
Creator of the Clarke Steel Drum Method
Cultural Ambassador for Caribbean Music

studentTestimonials.name: Jason Williams
studentTestimonials.quote: Master Clarke is a living legend. Learning from him is like touching the soul of Caribbean music.

studentTestimonials.name: Maria Santos
studentTestimonials.quote: His passion for the steel drum is infectious. He makes every student feel like they can master this beautiful instrument.

faculty.title: Professor of Dance & Movement
faculty.bio: Professor Diana Hamilton is a distinguished choreographer and dancer whose work celebrates the movement traditions of the Caribbean while pushing boundaries in contemporary dance. Her choreographic works have been performed by major dance companies across the Americas. At CAPAS, she leads students in discovering their unique movement voice while honoring traditional Caribbean dance forms.
education: M.F.A. in Dance, New York University
B.F.A. in Dance Performance, The Juilliard School
Certificate in Caribbean Dance Studies, National Dance Theatre Company Jamaica
achievements: Choreographer for international dance festivals
Recipient of the Caribbean Arts Movement Award
Founder of Hamilton Contemporary Dance Company
Featured choreographer on BBC Arts

studentTestimonials.name: Gabriella Johnson
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Hamilton sees movement possibilities that others miss. She's helped me find my voice as a dancer.

studentTestimonials.name: Anthony Davis
studentTestimonials.quote: Her classes are challenging but incredibly rewarding. She pushes you to discover your artistic limits.

faculty.title: Associate Professor of Theatre Arts
faculty.bio: Professor James Mitchell brings extensive professional theatre experience to CAPAS, having worked as an actor and director throughout the Caribbean and North America. His passion lies in developing authentic Caribbean theatrical voices while providing students with classical training in acting techniques. He believes in theatre as a powerful tool for cultural expression and social commentary.
education: M.F.A. in Directing, Yale School of Drama
B.F.A. in Acting, SUNY Purchase
Certificate in Caribbean Theatre Studies, University of the West Indies
achievements: Director of award-winning Caribbean theatre productions
Actor in major television and film productions
Founder of the Caribbean Theatre Collective
Recipient of the Regional Theatre Excellence Award

studentTestimonials.name: Samantha Green
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Mitchell's directing is transformative. He helps you find truth in every character you play.

studentTestimonials.name: Christopher Wilson
studentTestimonials.quote: His classes are like masterclasses. Every session teaches you something new about the craft of acting.

faculty.title: Professor of Piano & Music Theory
faculty.bio: Professor Maria Gonzalez is a virtuoso pianist whose performances span classical, jazz, and Caribbean music styles. Her deep understanding of music theory combined with her practical performance experience makes her an exceptional teacher. She specializes in helping students develop both technical excellence and musical expression, regardless of their starting level.
education: D.M.A. in Piano Performance, University of Miami
M.M. in Jazz Studies, Manhattan School of Music
B.M. in Classical Piano, New England Conservatory
achievements: Soloist with Caribbean and international orchestras
Recording artist with 6 critically acclaimed albums
Winner of the International Caribbean Music Competition
Master class teacher at major conservatories

studentTestimonials.name: Roberto Silva
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Gonzalez is incredibly patient and encouraging. She's helped me develop confidence at the piano.

studentTestimonials.name: Nicole Thompson
studentTestimonials.quote: Her music theory classes are challenging but so rewarding. She makes complex concepts understandable.

faculty.title: Assistant Professor of Guitar & Popular Music
faculty.bio: Professor Kevin Smith bridges traditional and contemporary music through his expertise in both classical guitar and modern popular music styles. As a performing musician and music producer, he brings real-world industry experience to his teaching. His innovative approach incorporates music technology and contemporary performance practices while maintaining strong foundational skills.
education: M.M. in Guitar Performance, Peabody Institute
B.M. in Music Production, Berklee College of Music
Certificate in Music Technology, SAE Institute
achievements: Grammy-nominated session guitarist
Producer for major Caribbean recording artists
Founder of Caribbean Music Technology Lab
International touring musician

studentTestimonials.name: Ashley Miller
studentTestimonials.quote: Professor Smith is so current with music technology. He's preparing us for the modern music industry.

studentTestimonials.name: Ryan Johnson
studentTestimonials.quote: His guitar technique is flawless, and he's great at breaking down complex pieces into manageable parts.

faculty.title: Professor of Music Education & Community Outreach
faculty.bio: Dr. Linda Williams is dedicated to making music education accessible to all members of the community. Her extensive background in educational psychology and music pedagogy informs her innovative teaching methods. She leads CAPAS's community outreach programs and develops curriculum that serves learners of all ages and backgrounds.
education: Ph.D. in Music Education, Teachers College Columbia University
M.Ed. in Educational Psychology, Harvard Graduate School of Education
B.M. in Music Education, Florida State University
achievements: Developer of the CAPAS Community Music Program
Recipient of the National Music Education Excellence Award
Author of curriculum used in Caribbean schools
Consultant for UNESCO music education initiatives

studentTestimonials.name: Patricia Davis
studentTestimonials.quote: Dr. Williams shows how music can truly transform communities. Her passion for education is inspiring.

studentTestimonials.name: Marcus Thompson
studentTestimonials.quote: She taught me that every student can learn music if you find the right approach. Life-changing perspective.
